1284637079473922049.text: Last year, I had the privilege of joining Congressman John Lewis on a civil rights pilgrimage through Alabama. I took this powerful video of him telling the story of the march from Selma to Montgomery & across the Edmund Pettus Bridge, & the brutal beating he endured. https://t.co/u3QMFlG7Tf

1284488336908914689.text: While we mourn the death of John Lewis, we celebrate and remember his life. The lessons he taught us will live on as we strive to make this a more perfect union.

1284488336078512132.text: It was an honor to accompany John Lewis in Selma, Alabama last year to visit landmarks including the Edmund Pettus Bridge, and to reflect on some of the most painful parts of our nation’s history.

1284488334887223296.text: We mourn this incalculable loss at a tumultuous moment for America. Even in his final weeks, John Lewis joined peaceful protesters to stand up against injustice – always teaching us and showing us what good trouble truly means.

1284488334098735104.text: Last night, our nation lost the Conscience of the Congress, a fearless civil rights icon, and a great man: Congressman John Lewis. America is a better place because of John Lewis and his fearless dedication to freedom & justice, no matter the cost.
